alert.note: Alert for East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Far Northeast Highlands (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Wind Advisory issued December 12 at 8:37PM MST until December 12 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM MST THIS EVENING... ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON MST TUESDAY... * WHAT...For the Wind Advisory, west winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 50 mph. For the High Wind Warning, west winds 30 to 40 mph with gusts up to 60 mph expected. * WHERE...East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains and Far Northeast Highlands. * WHEN...For the Wind Advisory, until 11 PM MST this evening. For the High Wind Warning, until Noon MST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Damaging winds will blow down trees and power lines. Power outages are possible. Travel will be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. Expect strong crosswinds on area roadways. Blowing snow can also reduce visibilities through high mountain passes of the Sangre de Cristo Mountains.
info.instruction: Take action to secure trash cans, lawn furniture, and other loose or lightweight outdoor objects. Extremely hazardous driving conditions can be expected, especially for motorists in high profile vehicles who should consider delaying travel.

area.areaDesc: East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Far Northeast Highlands
